title: After War’s Success, Tiger Shroff Wants To Outdo Mission Impossible & Avengers In 'Baaghi 3'
text:
Tiger Shroff has done quite some movies in his career spanning over five years and most of them have been action films. So, he has typecast himself as an action hero, and the audiences simply love seeing him perform some high-octane stunts.

In his latest release, which starred his idol Hrithik Roshan alongside him, Tiger Shroff once again showed what he is capable of. The fact that the film has minted Rs 200 crores already proves that the audiences love him too.

Twitter

But isn’t Tiger Shroff doing the same thing in every movie? He also fears about being repetitive. For his next, Baaghi 3, he believes his competition isn’t only with films like Mission Impossible and Avengers, but he has to also compete with himself.

Twitter

Don't Miss 357 SHARES 1.7 K SHARES 695 SHARES 706 SHARES 704 SHARES

“It is a problem, no doubt. I don’t only have to compete with Mission Impossible and The Avengers but also with myself. I am expected to raise the level of action with every film. It is a challenge but a welcome challenge,” he told Bollywood Humgama in an interview.

The report further added that in Baaghi 3, the makers wanted to take Tiger Shroff’s action scenes to another level. But seemingly, that has already happened in War. So, now there is a change in plan.

Twitter

It was earlier said that Tiger would go to Israel to learn Krav Maga, which is a form of martial arts. But than plan has been seemingly scrapped because that could look similar to the action sequences we saw in War.

Baaghi 3 is slated to hit the screens on March 6, 2020.
description: But isn’t Tiger Shroff doing the same thing in every movie? Not as of now, and he also fears to not repeat himself. For his next, Baaghi 3, he believes his competition isn’t only with films like Mission Impossible and Avengers, but he has to also compete with himself.
